text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
—— That's when I told the secretary: 
"Allow me to question the purpose 
of this question."

text_block_list.name: Katsuragi Ace
text_block_list.text:
Ooh, that's pretty smooth! 
Your jokes could run for president, 
Ms. President!

text_block_list.name: Mr. C.B.
text_block_list.text: Aha, you're not too bad yourself, Ace.

text_block_list.name: Katsuragi Ace
text_block_list.text:
Well, I'm pretty fussy when 
it comes to corny puns.

text_block_list.name: Katsuragi Ace
text_block_list.text:
Back where I'm from, the old fellas in the 
neighborhood would use them every day 
like greetings. I naturally developed an ear 
for them, y'know?

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Indeed, your puns tend to be both witty 
and refined. Truly exceptional. My own 
can only hope to reach such heights.

text_block_list.name: Katsuragi Ace
text_block_list.text:
You just need more experience. I'm telling 
you, corny puns were a third of what came 
out of the old fellas' mouths.

text_block_list.name: Katsuragi Ace
text_block_list.text:
Shouting stuff like "If I lost an egg here, will 
it grow an eggplant?", "Don't be rash with 
the radishes now!", and "Wee'd better deal 
with them weeds!" out on the farms.

text_block_list.name: Mr. C.B.
text_block_list.text:
Ohh, so that's how they do it. Why don't 
you try using your environment as inspiration 
too, Rudolf? Think training, or races!

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Training…… What do you call your running 
partner? Your sole mate! Be careful, raise 
your pace before you race the Stakes.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
! Hahah, this could be a useful new trick…… 
I'll devise more jokes using familiar subjects, 
and gain experience that way, too. Two birds 
with one stone, as the saying goes.
